content.description: Start as per The Blade, but once established in the roof, head straight out to the lip with a series of bumps and compression with some creative footwork. The landing was leveled off with a bunch of rocks so it is safe with two pads and a spotter.
content.protection: Two pads, or one large one.

content.description: From the same starting hold as the other routes. You’ll hit the big jug pocket, then head slightly right, entering the crux and teetering spookily close to the edge of the drop off. Wild!
content.protection: Three pads. One could likely remove all the spook-factor with a harness and a rope wrapped around the boulder uphill so you don't fall off the drop off if you bounce off the pads.

content.description:
The Blade is an incredible boulder problem that climbs the longest duration of the roof.

The crux comes towards the end of the roof on a series of burly moves on small (but nicely uncut) crimps to some thank god jugs and a mantle finish. This route is very, very good!

Add some extra pump by beginning down around the corner at the farthest possible sit start. The hand traverse is 12’ and only

V0 but it definitely makes the finish more memorable!
content.protection: One or two pads, plus a spotter.
